channel.title: A WINDOW TO THE MAGIC: DISNEYLAND AUDIO ADVENTURE
channel.description: An unofficial Disneyland Podcast. Disneyland Theme Park Magic brought to you in FULL STEREO SOUND!!

image.title: A WINDOW TO THE MAGIC: DISNEYLAND AUDIO ADVENTURE

channel.itunes:author: Disney Sounds Guy, Paul Barrie, Jr.
channel.itunes:summary: The Ultimate Disneyland Audio Adventure Experience. A celebration of the magical sounds of Disney in FULL STEREO SOUND, brought to you by "the Disney Sounds Guy" Paul Barrie. A WindowtotheMagic is a weekly journey into the wonderful world of the Disney Theme Parks, and the sounds which make those parks so fantastic. Containing everything from Disney created "source audio" to sounds recorded "live" at Disneyland, this is just the fix every Disney fan needs when they can't get to the park. Do you remember the Goodyear peoplemover? Do you love the Adventure thru Inner Space? Then this is the show for you!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Disney Lovers Unite! The ULTIMATE Disney Theme Park Show.

item.title: WTTM WDW 009 - "How to DESTROY a Classic Experience"
item.description: HEADPHONES REQUIRED!In this episode, Jeremiah takes you on a soundscape filled journey into a WDW only to have the final destination experience completely ruined, in Paul's opinion, by castmembers that seem to have absolutely no respect for the hard work and effort that went into creating this classic Disney attraction.  They only seem to be interested in rustling the guests and hurrying them through as quickly as possible.This one should be forwarded to WDW attractions management for review of procedures.  Editing this show irritated the bejeebers out of Paul.Enjoy!*********************************THE WTTM PODCAST APPLICATIONSfor iPhone, iPad & iPod Touch & now for Android & Kindle FireMobile access to the shows, and MUCH more!The WindowtotheMagic Podcast App:Apple:  http://tinyurl.com/wttmappAndroid: http://tinyurl.com/wttmapp3Get the App, and inside is a coupon good for $15.00 off a Multi-DVD order from the WTTM DVD Store... exclusive for wttm app users only.*********************************Visit Disneyland in the first 5 years it existed!THE ORIGINAL DISNEYLAND: THE 1950'sThe Exciting DVD from WTTM and Spotted Dog Productions created from the actual family home movies of over 50 families that visited Disneyland from 1955-1959.Exclusive footage never seen before of Walt's Dream shot by the guests who experienced it.http://store.windowtothemagic.com/tj-orig-dl.html*********************************This podcast is brought to you by:  The recurring supporters of WindowtotheMagic!If you enjoy WindowtotheMagic, please visit our website andsign up for a small recurring support donation today!http://www.windowtothemagic.comThank you for supporting the Magic!*********************************OTHER EXCITING WAYS item.title: WTTM #338 - "Let's Try This AGAIN!"
item.description: This week, Paul and Tairy attempt to rectify the mistakes from the last show #336...For those of you wondering who was right when Tairy was challenging the cast member about the trolley number, this is the text from the Plaque at the "Storytellers" Statue in Carthay Circle at DCA…It was July 1923. I packed all of my worldly goods – a pair of trousers, a checkered coat, a lot of drawing materials and the last of the fairy tale reels we had made – in a kind of frayed cardboard suitcase. And with that wonderful audacity of youth, I went to Hollywood, arriving there with just forty dollars. It was a big day the day I got on that Santa Fe California Limited. I was just free and happy!  ~Walt DisneyThe red car (#623) would have been named 7/23, but they wanted 2 different "series" of red car with different paint jobs, so they used the 600 series paint and "fib" a little during the red car narration.  However, I am SURE that most of the red car trolley cast members are unaware of this little date swap or, at least, have been told to act unaware.Enjoy!*********************************WTTM24 SEASON 2 IS GOING STRONG!Search "WTTM" in iTunesGet a new hour our Paul & Greg's day at Disneyland every 2 weeks!It's the most magical concept in podcasting!*********************************DOUBLE YOUR WTTM & WTTM24 FUN!BECOME A RECURRING SUPPORTERfor as little as $5.00/month !http://www.windowtothemagic.com*********************************THE WTTM PODCAST APPLICATIONSfor iPhone, iPad & iPod Touch & now for Android & Kindle FireMobile access to the shows, and MUCH more!The WindowtotheMagic Podcast App:Apple:  http://tinyurl.com/wttmappAndroid: http://tinyurl.com/wttmapp3Get the App, and inside is a coupon good for $15.00 off a Multi-DVD order from the WTTM DVD Store... exclusive for wttm app users only.The WTTM24 Podcast AppFOR iOS:    http://tinyurl.com/wttm24appFREE! with the ability to get premium content with a support subscription.Also Available for Android!http://tinyurl.com/wttm24app2*********************************Visit Disneyland in the first 5 years it existed!THE ORIGINAL DISNEYLAND: THE 1950'sThe new DVD from WTTM and Spotted Dog Productions created from the actual family home movies of over 50 families that visited Disneyland from 1955-1959.Exclusive footage never seen before of Walt's Dream shot by the guests who experienced it.http://store.windowtothemagic.com/tj-orig-dl.html*********************************Email me if you read this…  I'm curious if anyone readsthe show notes.  Thanks.*********************************This podcast is brought to you by:You.Visit http://www.windowtothemagic.com for informationon how to become a recurring supporter of WindowtotheMagic...*********************************OTHER EXCITING WAYS TO ENHANCE YOUR WTTM EXPERIENCE*********************************The WindowtotheMagic Family of Podcast & VideocastsThe Original WindowtotheMagic Audio Podcasthttp://itunes.apple.com/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/viewPodcast?id=77245374The WindowtotheMagic Videocast (HIGH Definition)http://itunes.apple.com/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/viewPodcast?id=300127061WindowtotheMagic 24 Season 2http://itunes.apple.com/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/viewPodcast?id=389305897*********************************Email: podcast@windowtothemagic.comVoicemail: (307)GET-WTTMTwitter: http://www.twitter.com/wttmFacebook: http://www.facebook.com/wttmpodcast*********************************PLEASE SUPPORT WindowtotheMagic!BUY A WTTM DVD TODAYhttp://store.windowtothemagic.com*********************************100 Mins  ))HD Binaural((

item.title: WTTM #331 - Submitted For Your Approval

item.title: WTTM 24: Season 2 "Preshow"
item.description: (This is the only episode of WTTM24 Season 2 that will appear on the main wttm feed.  Please subscribe to wttm24 to enjoy the entire season) This week, four years after Season 1 set the podcast world on fire, and one week prior to the official start of WTTM24 Season 2, Paul, Greg & Magic Joe got together on Skype to discuss the concept and conception of the internet's only real-time audio adventure podcast.  Season 2 begins April 2, 2012… ONLY on the WTTM24 FEED  Search wttm24 in iTunes to subscribe!Enjoy...  *********************************This podcast is brought to you by:WindowtotheMagic.com & TouringPlans.comPlease visit your favorite app store and search for the "lines" apps from TouringPlans.com.  Download the app for free and use code "window2012" to save 15% off your advanced services subscription.  Listen to Paul & Greg use the app during the show for a great preview of the app and what it can do for you at Disneyland AND at Walt Disney World!********************************* WTTM24 is a production of WindowtotheMagic.com and is © 2008-2012 Paul J Barrie Jr All Disney copyrights for names, places, audio, etc. remain © Disney WTTM24 MUSIC CREDIT: Al Phlipp and the Woo Team: Music for Backgrounds Used with permission through music.podshow.com Learn more about Al Phlipp and the Woo Team at their website: http://www.kevinwillis.net/wooteam/albums.php WTTM24 ARTWORK CREDIT: Peter Hardcastle - E-mail: peter.anim8or@gmail.com Many thanks to the following people for their help in the creation of WTTM24: Mouseketeer Greg Magic Joe Clinton Alvord (www.comedy4cast.com) Calvin Barrie Tairy Barrie (www.lrwh.us) Jeremiah (Jerm) Josh & Katie (Theme Park Talk) for without their help, WTTM24 would not have been what it turned out to be... Please let us know what you think of WTTM24: Email: podcast@windowtothemagic.com Voicemail: 206-984-WTTM (9886) Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/wttm24 FaceBook: http://www.facebook.com/wttm24 PLEASE SUPPORT WindowtotheMagic!

item.title: WTTM #273 - Thru New Eyes
item.description: This week, we explore the following idea...What if you had been going to Disneyland throughout your life, but your vision was never good enough to really ever SEE the park.  Then, one day, your vision became clear.  Clear enough that Disneyland seems like a whole new park, with details you have NEVER seen before...This is what is currently happening to Tairy.And her child-like wonder is one of the MANY reasons why I love her so much...Enjoy!*********************************TAIRY AND PAUL GOT MARRIED!For information, please visit http://www.windowtothemagic.com/wedding/The item.title: Haunted In A Buggy During Halloween
item.description: Much Thanks to "DJ Wazowski" for this Halloween audio fun!  Paul will see you all on 11/1... Here is what Jeff said about his creation: ************ Mongello Everyone!Well its happened, those unemployment checks from AATM have stopped coming in. So of course that means its time to roll up the shirt sleeves, put on the headphones and get back in the studio.For fun this week I have been working on a Halloween remix/mashup that answers the question "what if" you could put your own theme music to a Disney attraction. Being that its October I decided to put some scary movie themes under some selected audio tracks from the Haunted Mansion. The results turned out pretty good although I had no luck mixing Grim Grinning Ghosts over the Gremlins theme. So as you'll hear, I just let the music play during that section. But if you use a little imagination you can picture a gang of Gremlins singing "Grim Grinning Ghosts come out, Grim Grinning Ghosts come out" while crawling and jumping through the graveyard.The other underlying tracks include the theme from Halloween and Tubular Bells from the Exorcist.Happy Haunting and may your goody bags be full,DJ Wazowski (That's Jeff W for those of you living in Minnesota.)

item.title: Shermania!
item.description: Produced as a tribute to Disney Legends, the Sherman Brothers, "Shermania!" the film began life first as a song.  Robert and Richard Sherman's Father, Tin Pan Alley tune-smith, Al Sherman, told his boys to follow the three S’s when writing songs: make them singable, simple, and sincere.With that ideal as inspiration, composer Jerry Ranger and author/lyricist Cynthia Ferrell co-wrote the song, "Singable, Simple, and Sincere".  The song is performed by Tess Ferrell, now lead singer in "Big Band Beat," a broadway-style show on the American Waterfront at Tokyo DisneySea.The film, now titled, "Shermania!" was shot over the course of two days in August 2010 in Los Angeles and Thousand Oaks, California, under the direction of Cynthia Ferrell & Brian McDonald and stars Tess Ferrell and Jerry Ranger.  Other credits include:Cinematographer: Tim CarrEditors: Brian McDonald, Chuck Lewis & Nick BroscoBoom operator and production support: Gary ChambersScript supervisor: Nancy FriedmanMusical arrangement & performance: David VasquezRecorded, mixed, & mastered: Jeff Lewis at Moonlight Studios, Los AngelesWith special thanks to Gregg ShermanThe film is distributed by the Mouse Lounge PodcastYou are welcome to introduce the film and add your own title sequence per what is customary for your program.  We ask however, that once "Shermania!" begins that it is played it's entire 4:19 running time, including end credits.  No subtitles, edits, or additions to the video is permitted.  The video remains under copyright protection held by Jerry A. Ranger and Cynthia Ferrell.Thank you all again for participating in the wide release of a film that was made as a labor of love for the Sherman Brothers, who left their indelible mark not only on Disney, but the world of entertainment!

item.title: WTTM #251 "A Tale of Two Space Mountains"
item.description: This week, after 2 shows of epic length, we return to a normal length episode.WDI recently added "starry-o-phonic" sound to Space Mountain at The Magic Kingdom at Walt Disney World, which, as far as I can gather, is a series of over 60 speakers throughout the ride to provide a new soundtrack without the expense of adding audio equipment in the ride vehicles.So, because of this, I asked John Corigliano (mousetimes podcast) to record the new ride experience for me.  Before we hear the new stuff, I take you to DisneyLAND to ride Space Mountain with me and my good friend Jeff Dewey.So, which do YOU like best?Let us know by leaving your thoughts over at: http://wttmforums.com/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=3142*********************************PLEASE SUPPORT THE SHOW!BECOME A RECURRING item.title: A WindowtotheMagic - Show #244 - MDM #17 "Celebrate You..."
item.description: This week, Magic Joe returns to celebrate America with American Journeys & Disneyland's 30th Anniversary Parade.  Then, after the show "ends" Paul adds a little "classic audio" of his own.  This is a recording of America the Beautiful recorded LIVE at Disneyland just hours before the Annual Passholder (AP) Light Magic Premiere on May 13, 1997.  I am not sure why this appears to be in mono, as I was using a setereo recorder... I guess I am just gonna have to see if I can find the ORIGINAL tape that I recorded the show onto...  You know... item.title: WTTM-SE003 WonderCon Press Event - Prince of Persia
item.description: Prince Of Persia: The Sands of Time - Join Jerry Bruckheimer (producer), Mike Newell (director), Jake Gyllenhaal (actor, "Prince Dastan"), and Jordan Mechner (screen story, game creator), as they take the WonderCon stage to discuss Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time which had a May 28 release. Set in the mystical lands of Persia, Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time is an epic action-adventure about a rogue prince (Jake Gyllenhaal) and a mysterious princess (Gemma Arterton) who race against dark forces to safeguard an ancient dagger capable of releasing the Sands of Time - a gift from the gods that can reverse time and allow its possessor to rule the world.
item.itunes:subtitle: Prince Of Persia: The Sands of Time - Join Jerry Bruckheimer (producer), Mike Newell (director), Jake Gyllenhaal (actor, "Prince Dastan"), and Jordan Mechner (screen story, game creator), as they take the WonderCon stage to discuss Prince of Persia:...

item.title: WTTM-SE002 WonderCon Press Event - Toy Story 3
item.description: Toy Story 3 - From the studio that has taken you into the worlds of space, sea and superheroes, comes a comical new 3D adventure in which Buzz, Woody and the gang face an uncertain future as Andy gears up for college. When the toys unexpectedly land in a room full of untamed tots who can't wait to get their sticky little fingers on them, it's pandemonium as they try to stay together. Directed by Lee Unkrich, the film features all the familiar favorites, plus a host of new toys including Barbie's friend Ken, a pink teddy bear named Lots-o'-Huggin' Bear and a thespian hedgehog named Mr. Pricklepants. Join director Lee Unkrich live on the WonderCon stage to present an exclusive sneak-peek at Toy Story 3.
item.itunes:subtitle: Toy Story 3 - From the studio that has taken you into the worlds of space, sea and superheroes, comes a comical new 3D adventure in which Buzz, Woody and the gang face an uncertain future as Andy gears up for college. When the toys unexpectedly land...

item.title: WTTM-SE001 WonderCon Press Event - Sorcerer's Apprentice
item.description: The Sorcerer's Apprentice - Join Jerry Bruckheimer (producer), Jon Turteltaub (director), Nicolas Cage (actor, "Balthazar Blake"), Jay Baruchel (actor, "Dave Stutler"), Teresa Palmer (actress, "Becky") live on the Esplanade stage to present an exclusive look at The Sorcerer's Apprentice. Dave (Jay Baruchel) is just an average college student, or so it appears, until the sorcerer Balthazar Blake (Nicolas Cage) recruits him as his reluctant protege. The sorcerer gives his unwilling accomplice a crash course in the art and science of magic, and together, these unlikely partners pit their powers against those of the fiercest and most ruthless practitioners of all time. It'll take all the courage Dave can muster to survive his training, save the city, and get the girl as he becomes the Sorcerer's Apprentice.

item.title: A WindowtotheMagic - Show #235 - Pinocchio Part 1
item.description: This week, Paul is joined by Leo Holzer as we sit on the porch of the Walt Disney Family Museum to chat with authors JB Kaufman & Russell Merritt.  Topics include their book "Walt in Wonderland" and we discuss, at length, several aspects of the movie Pinocchio.If you got to talk to 2 Disney historians, what would YOU discuss?Also, listen for instructions for how to enter to win a copy of "Walt in Wonderland" from WindowtotheMagic.*************************************************************THE WTTM PODCAST APPLICATIONfor iPhone & iPod TouchMobile access to the shows, and MUCH more!http://tinyurl.com/wttmappGet the App, and receive a coupon good for $15.00 off a Multi-DVD order from the WTTM DVD Store... exclusive for wttm app users only.*********************************GET YOUR COPY TODAY!THE ORIGINAL DISNEYLAND: THE 1950'SThe new DVD from WTTM and Spotted Dog Productionscreated from the actual family home movies of over 50familys that visited Disneyland from 1955-1960.Exclusive footage never seen before of Walt's Dreamshot by the guests who experienced it.http://store.windowtothemagic.com/tj-orig-dl.html*********************************This podcast is brought to you by:Karl Susman's hilarious new book - item.title: A WindowtotheMagic #213 - JB Kaufman
item.description: This week, we have  a little bit different of a show.  Recently Paul went to the Walt Disney Family Museum for the October WTTM Meet of the Month and was lucky enough to be able to attend a screening of the 3 Caballeros followed by a discussion of the film and light discussion of Walt Disney's famous Good Neighbor Program tour to South America which spawned several films, including Saludos Amigos and the 3 Caballeros.  Paul was given permission by Donna Tuggle, director of Education and Public Programs for the WDFM to capture the audio of JB Kaufman's discussion before and after the film, and this week, that is the audio we will be sharing with you.  We'll begin with Donna introducing JB and his short introduction to the film (3 caballeros) which we were about to see.  Then, we play for you a sampling of the wonderful soundtrack from the film, as we meet up with JB after the movie for more information, some Q&A from the crowd and then, as a bonus, we will talk personally with JB about Walt Disney, JB's fascination with Disney, and JB's new book, South of the Border with Disney, Walt Disney and the Good Neighbor Program 1941-1948...   So sit back as you virtually attend the first WTTM WDFM MOTM... and maybe someday soon we'll see all of you in person at the museum for one of our  meets.*********************************GET YOUR COPY TODAY!THE ORIGINAL DISNEYLAND: THE 1950'SThe new DVD from WTTM and Spotted Dog Productionscreated from the actual family home movies of over 50familys that visited Disneyland from 1955-1960.Exclusive footage never seen before of Walt's Dreamshot by the guests who experienced it.http://store.windowtothemagic.com/tj-orig-dl.html*********************************This podcast is brought to you by:DESTINATIONS IN FLORIDA item.title: A WindowtotheMagic - Show #199.50
item.description: A few things of importance, and then Magic Joe takes us back in time...*********************************************TICKETS NOW AVAILABLE!The FriendsoftheMagic Gathering will have a special dinner on Saturday night for our group and we hope you will join us!Where: Ralph Brennan's Jazz Kitchen - Downtown DisneyWhen: Saturday, July 25th, 2009  6PM (please arrive early)Why: Cuz we are gonna be hungry!THIS EVENT REQUIRES THE PRE-PURCHASE OF A DINNER TICKET FOR EVERY MEMBER OF YOUR PARTY.There are only 48 seats available TOTAL!Once they are gone, they are gone, and we do NOT have the option to add seats to this arrangement.  This NOT a banquet, but a large-party seating at a restaurant that will be open to other park guests at the same time that we are dining.  There will be many tables, and you will be seated based on availability.NO REFUNDS are allowed.  Please email me before purchasing, if you have any questions, but be aware that this event WILL SELL OUT FAST!To purchase your tickets, use the following link:http://tinyurl.com/fotmdinner09You can use PayPal or a credit card for payment.We look forward to seeing you there!---Paul J Barrie JrHost of "A WindowtotheMagic - The Disney Audio Adventure Show"Enjoy the sounds of the park on our weekly journeys into thewonderful world of the Disney sound experience!http://www.windowtothemagic.com/podcast.htmlWe (would) climb the highest mountains,just to get a better view.We (would) plumb the deepest oceans,because we're daring through and through.We (would) cross the scorching desert,martinis in our hand.We (would) ski the polar ice caps,in tuxedos looking grand.We (would be) reckless, brave, and loyal,and valiant to the end.If you (came) in (t)here a stranger,you (would) exit as a friend.KUNGALOOSH!

item.title: A WindowtotheMagic - Show #153
item.description: The WindowtotheMagic Dream Team - Ryan!This week, we proudly bring you the first in a series of shows produced by the WindowtotheMagic Dream Team... a group of folks hand selected by Paul a few months back from a listener submission contest in early 2008.  They were originally supposed to fill in for Patrick as he fulfilled his duties at the Disney CMO.  When that fell through, Paul decided to still bring them in, and since Patrick has backed away from producing regular audio shows, he will be using their shows occasionally to give the listeners a break from Paul's shows...The first show is from Ryan Dour.  Ryan is a good friend of Paul's and is a very talented guy.  He is visually impaired, yet still visits the Disney parks by himself, and most times doesn't need any assistance to get around and have a great time. Awesome, huh?Join us as we follow Ryan around the Magic Kingdom.**************************************************** OTHER EXCITING WAYS TO ENHANCE YOUR WTTM EXPERIENCE **************************************************** BE SURE TO VISIT THE ALL NEW WINDOWTOTHEMAGIC STORE FOR GREAT NEW MERCHANDISE, FEATURING PAUL, PATRICK, AND THE WORLD FAMOUS WTTM LOGOS! http://www.cafepress.com/wttmpodcast ****************************** JOIN WINDOWTOTHEMAGIC FOR A REAL-TIME AUDIO ADVENTURE IN DISNEYLAND WTTM24 NOW AVAILABLE IN ITUNES - SEARCH "WTTM" **************************************************** PLEASE REMEMBER TO FILL OUT THE WTTM SURVEY. IT ONLY TAKES 3 MINS! http://www.wizzard.tv/survey/pbarrie ************ Follow WTTM on twitter for exclusive content links, contests, prizes, games, and sooooo much more! item.title: A WindowtotheMagic - Show #142 - A Window to NO Magic
item.description:
Its been almost 3 years since we began the podcast portion of WindowtotheMagic, and with almost 150 episodes in the can, we thought it might be fun to share a little "behind the scenes" information with you...
You recall all those wonderful trips into the parks where everything goes beautifully, and things just fall into place to make a wonderful Disney Audio Adventure... everything goes right... Paul doesn't blow his lines... the bands start and stop at the right time... the lines for rides are wonderfully short and shows begin right as we sit down...
Have you ever wondered what would happen if we went into the park to record a classic "whereinthepark?" game and absolutely nothing went as planned? Well, you are about to find out... Plus, Paul will be popping in occasionally throughout this show to explain what he was trying to do, and then you can listen to what actually happened...

item.title: A WindowtotheMagic - Show #139 - Cool Factor 10
item.description: This week, we push the limits of the Disney Sound experience as we present highlights from Rob Verdi's SAXOPHOBIA! A live on stage performance featuring a wide assortment of saxophones, including the worlds smallest and largest saxes, the sopranino and contrabass! If you like what you are hearing, please visit WWW.SAXOPHOBIA.NET or email Rob directly at CLASSICSAX@SBCGLOBAL.NET and tell them you heard about his band on WindowtotheMagic and ask for information about his new CD - SAXOPHOBIA! Thanks to Rob Verdi for giving Paul permission to use this recording on the podcast. item.title: A WindowtotheMagic - Show #132
item.description: This week finds Paul and Tairy leaving the world of tomorrow and making their way over to Adventureland (stopping to catch part of a castle show along the way) to experience 2 classic Disneyland attractions, which were re-imagineered for the Magic Kingdom at Walt Disney World.  This show is a little more of a stream of consciousness show than previous shows.  It is a great training wheels show to prepare you for WTTM24, which was recorded this last Saturday at Disneyland, and will premiere on Friday February 29, 2008 on this feed.Enjoy, and stay tuned for more information on WTTM24 next week.**************************************************** OTHER EXCITING WAYS TO ENHANCE YOUR WTTM EXPERIENCE **************************************************** JOIN WINDOWTOTHEMAGIC FOR A REAL-TIME AUDIO ADVENTURE IN DISNEYLANDWTTM24COMING FEBRUARY 29, 2008 TO THIS FEED****************************************************PLEASE REMEMBER TO FILL OUT THE WTTM SURVEY. item.title: A WindowtotheMagic - Show #127 - Beary Christmas
item.description:
On the first day of Christmas... I said to my mate... I'm a goin' huntin, and I might be home late.  The next day of Christmas, seems I've lost my way.... and I ain't seen my cabin, since dawn yesterday...  Oh! What a Christmas... I'm lonely and lost. I'm shakin' and sneezin and c-c-covered with frost.  I fell in the river, and lost all my food.  Dont sing me no caroles, cuz I ain't in the mood.Merry Christmas from the ENTIRE WindowtotheMagic Team! **************************************************** OTHER EXCITING WAYS TO ENHANCE YOUR WTTM EXPERIENCE ****************************************************

item.title: WindowtotheMagic Podcast Show #111
item.description: Join Paul this week for another method of Surrounding Yourself with the Magic. Not everyone likes the music, the movies, the international affair. For some, it is a numbers game. Walt always preferred to hear the phrase "Yes, if..." It was his way of stopping people from giving excuses why an idea wouldn't work. Can this work? Yes, if... Dr. Buzz Price takes us on a journey to 1955 and beyond through his story... the story of the man who told Walt where he should put Disneyland. WTTM @ the NFFC: Join the WindowtotheMagic team for a week of magic and in person encounters with the people who make the magic. July 2008 in Anaheim, California. More information coming soon, so stay subscribed! ***************************** Email: podcast@windowtothemagic.com Voicemail: 206-984-WTTM (9886) Forums: http://wttmforums.com PLEASE SUPPORT WindowtotheMagic! item.title: WindowToTheMagic Podcast Show #100
item.description:
phew... we made it!
Its our 100th episode, and this show is a mix of "in studio" and "on location" audio.
First up is a thank you, and an exciting announcement for local Disney podcast fans in Northern California. Then, follow Patrick and Paul as they walk through Disneyland, meet up with friends and listeners, then stroll through the park on their way to a classic Disneyland attraction.
Visit http://store.windowtothemagic.com/schmoozefest.html to get your tickets after you hear the show!
Also included is a sneak preview review of Ratatouille from our good friend Adam.
Thanks to everone for listening to the first 100 shows, and we hope you will stick around for the next 100!
Email: podcast@windowtothemagic.com Voicemail: 206 984 9886 Discussion Forums: Coming Soon!
65 mins ))stereo and binaural((

This is a WhereinthePark? of sorts, and it is a fun place that we have not yet been on this show, so sit back, put on those headphones... and enjoy!

item.title: WindowToTheMagic Podcast Show #094
item.description:
Man... will I EVER recover from being at Westfest? I am STILL TIRED!
This week, we take you on a walk around the Disneyland Hotel with author Don Ballard. Don takes us on a journey through the history of the famous Hotel Disneyland, once owned by the Wrather Corporation.
Also this week, we have a short conversation with Lorien from the DPN boards and discuss our differing views on the Westfest experience.
Then we round out the show with a few voicemails including a submission for the theme song of DL Radio, my joke show from our April 1st episode.
***************
Coming Soon.... an UNofficial DPN meet-up in Northern California. Late July or Early August 2007 in the San Francisco Bay Area. Come and hang out with your friends and favorite podcasters during this all new UNOFFICIAL event. More details as they become available.
***************

item.title: WindowToTheMagic Podcast Show #091
item.description:
Hey,
This week we are going to head in a different direction. In past shows we have heard mostly sounds in their original form, But not this time. We are going to take a listen to what happens when you let pop stars, rock stars and a cheerleader take Disney songs and add their own twist.
Now how is this Surrounding yourself with the magic you ask? Well here at WindowtotheMagic we like to bring the best in Disney audio, and Disney records is no exception. So sit back relax (no driving!) and enjoy the show.
Meet the ENTIRE WindowtotheMagic Crew at Disneyland April 28th and 29th, 2007 for the first annual DPN WESTFEST.
DPN WESTFEST is a gathering of listeners from the Disney Podcast Network (http://www.thedpn.com) and the podcasters who create the shows!
All the events are free of charge (except for park admission and food) and we would love to see you there!
Visit the official DPN WESTFEST webpage for more information: http://www.disneypodcastnet.com/westfest.html
********
Email: podcast @windowtothemagic.com
Voicemail (206) 984-WTTM (9886)
Discussion Forums: http://www.disneypodcastnet.com/index.php?c=8
49 mins ))STEREO AND BINAURAL((

item.description:
*********HEADPHONES STRONGLY RECOMMENDED*********
Howdy Folks!
Now that you are done enjoying the latest video from Mouseketeer Greg, Paul takes you to Mousefest 2006 once again for another LONG ANTICIPATED set of audio clips.
Find out what happens when the DPN crew steps away from the spotlight and the crowds of adoring fans for a little time with just the boys (and the bleepin wife, of course). Listen in the left ear for a cameo appearance from the DPN's own vidcaster Chreestopher during the sing-a-long portion of our show.
Also in the show we find out what the entire backstory is behind Paul's time on stage at the adventurers club, and listen in as Hathaway Brown discovers that he has a serious disease.
We finish out this show with the return of an old friend... and some tough-tough-tough questions get answered.
Be sure to listen for instructions on how to enter and win our latest contest.

item.title: WindowToTheMagic Podcast Show #080
item.description:
This week, the WttM team brings you back to Mousefest 2006, to the "WindowtotheMagic WhereinthePark? LIVE Meet" at the Disney MGM Studios at Walt Disney World in Florida.
The biggest highlights of Mousefest are the planned group get-togethers where fans with similiar interests (inside the larger online Disney fandom) meet up to share their sub-set of Disney fun with each other.
WindowtotheMagic held a meet-up where we joined up with Ricky from Inside the Magic and Jeff from Meandering Mouse and we each took a group of people off to record concurrent park sound-seeing tours. The goal was to wander the studios for 15 minutes and then meet up at a common final location and share an experience as a group.
Everyone that joined in had a great time, and now you are invited to listen in as we share all 3 recordings with you.
Listen as Paul, Ricky, then Jeff take you around in their own individual styles, and then join us for a never-before-on-wttm experience.
WindowtotheMagic will be doing this again at Mousefest 07, so be sure to look us up when you are there, we would LOVE to have you along next time!!!
******** NEW DVDS AVAILABLE ***********
WONDERS OF LIFE
AND
3 NEW WINDOW SERIES DVDS:
MAIN STREET USA
TOM SAWYER ISLAND
FRONTIERLAND
Visit the WindowtotheMagic DVD Store for more information!
http://store.windowtothemagic.com/

Email podcast@windowtothemagic.com
Visit the WindowtotheMagic discussion forums at disneypodcastnet.com

item.title: WindowToTheMagic Podcast Show #074
item.description:
A very short show after a VERY LONG weekend.
This week WindowtotheMagic takes you along as Patrick enters the Magic Kingdom at Walt Disney World for the very first time, and experiences a very large castle, and a very small disney character. Along the way, listen to the Main Street entertainers singing and dancing.
I promise that MUCH MORE is on the way soon, including LOTS of Mousefest audio. However, after 4 days at WDW with 3 hours sleep each night... I am going to BED!
Enjoy!
Oh, one more thing before I go... If you want to see what happens when Paul gets pulled up on stage at the Adventurers club on pleasure Island at WDW, visit http://www.mkt3000.com/vids/ and click on the link named "Buela and Paul Barrie"

item.title: WindowToTheMagic Podcast Show #073
item.description:
Yes, you read right... Show #73
Patrick is still working on show #72, and since he has recently developed an ulcer, he has not felt too much like editing lately.
This week, to get you all ready for WindowtotheMagic's upcoming trip to Walt Disney World, we invited the original Walt Disney World podcaster - Ricky Brigante of the Inside the Magic podcast ( http://www.distantcreations.com/insidethemagic ) to guest host this week.
I asked Ricky a while back to record a specific "WhereinthePark?" game for me, and since the game ended up being over an hour long, we decided to just let him host the whole she-bang.
Ricky did an excellent job on this weeks show, and he even discovered a little bit of WDW that he had not experienced in quite some time, and he was glad to have experienced it. What was it? Just listen to find out!
Next week, Patrick and I will be coming to you LIVE from Walt Disney World in Florida, and will be bringing all the fun and excitement of Mousefest to you all. We will be recording nearly the entire time we are in Florida, and so we expect to have lots of fun Florida audio for you in the coming weeks and months, once this whole Christmas thing blows over for the year. =)
Patrick and Paul are going to be on hand for many of the events at Mousefest, and will even be hosting their own meet, WindowtotheMagic's WhereInThePark? LIVE! LISTEN TO EPISODE #71 FOR DETAILED INFORMATION. Visit http://www.mousefest.org for more information!
Save 25% on WindowtotheMagic DVDs by visiting http://store.windowtothemagic.com and entering the discount code "shownotes" upon checkout. There is no limit on maximum discount, however a minimum purchase is required. Most orders ship within 24 hours.
VoiceMail 206-984-WTTM (9886) Email podcast@windowtothemagic.com Visit the WindowtotheMagic discussion forums at disneypodcastnet.com
78 minutes ))STEREO((

item.title: WindowToTheMagic Podcast Show #071
item.description:
Howdy Folks!
This week, Paul takes you on a magic carpet excursion through Paris and Tokyo Christmas celebrations, a reader answers our call for negative feedback, Paul discusses Patrick and his plans for mousefest, Mouseketeer Greg shows us what is currently "playing" in Seattle, we enjoy listener emails and audio feedback and explore the little known (and really cool) story behind one of the critter houses in Splash Mountain in Florida.
Meet the WttM crew at MouseFest at Walt Disney World in December 2006! Patrick and Paul are going to be on hand for many of the events at Mousefest, and will even be hosting their own meet, WindowtotheMagic's WhereInThePark? LIVE! LISTEN TO THIS EPISODE FOR DETAILED INFORMATION.

item.description:

item.title: WindowToTheMagic Podcast Show #066
item.description:
Well... we were supposed to have a buddy-type show this week with Patrick and me answering emails, etc, but due to the long hours of editing on the Halloween show (15 hours at last count and he was almost half way done... ) when it came time to record the show... Patrick fell asleep and never got on Skype.
So... this is what I do when Patrick is not available.
I do a kick-butt show featuring a musical tribute to WDW!
On Sunday, the 29th of October 2006, the WindowtotheMagic.com podcast will present its annual Halloween extravaganza. Listen to this podcast to hear more about this all new show from the wttm players.

item.title: WindowToTheMagic Podcast Show #062
item.description: HE'S ON TIME!!!!!! That's right, Folks! Patrick Hurd's show this month is on time, thanks (in part) to WindowtotheMagic getting him a high-speed internet connection.Let's all breathe a sigh of relief! Ahhhhhhh. This month, Patrick takes us on a trip around the Rivers of America and through out the years to entertain and inform us about this very interesting section of Disneyland. With information about the river, Tom Sawyer Island, and the many attractions and events that have surrounded the river throughout Disneylands 50+ year history, this will easily be Patricks best show ever! We would like to thank this weeks sponsors, Don Ballard and MagicalHotel.com for their support of the WindowtotheMagic podcast. Visit the podcast page of the WindowtotheMagic.com website and click on the Disneyland hotel book link which will get you a special price reserved ONLY for wttm listeners. Save over $10.00 on this fantastic book! ApePenPublishing.com continues to sponsor the WindowtotheMagic.com Podcast, and we thank Carlene for her continued support. Please visit apepenpublishing.com and join the APP forums for your chance to win great prizes, including one of a kind signed artwork from Disney Imagineers, as well as copies of her fabulous hard bound books of Disneyland photography HOMECOMING: Destination Disneyland and Disneyland: The Beginning. Congratulations to Jimmy Ford, of Garden grove, CA for being our first ever "shownotes" contest winner. Jimmy, please send your mailing address to us at podcast@windowtothemagic.com, and be sure to let us know which WindowtotheMagic DVD you wish to receive. Thanks to everyone who played! Keep reading the shownotes for more fun games like this one...! If you didn't win, and would like to save some money on WindowtotheMagic.com DVDs, please visit http://store.windowtothemagic.com and enter the code "shownotes" at checkout to save 25% on any DVD purchase of $30.00 or more. VoiceMail 206-984-WTTM (9886) Email podcast@windowtothemagic.com Discussion forums at wttmforums.com 62mins ))STEREO((

item.description:
WindowtotheMagic takes you to the Disneyland resort this week, for a walk around the park to enjoy a few of the parks offerings in a Where in the Park... of sorts. Straw Hats, Over-alls, Main Sails and Thundering Mountains in the distance are all part of the show. Then, listen to what happens when a ride-thru goes awry, when a very talkative guest sits in the row behind me on a classic Disney attraction.

item.title: WindowToTheMagic.com Podcast Show #055
item.description:
Brought to you by ApePenPublishing.com and Sky-Magic.com, it's the WindowtotheMagic.com Podcast!
This week Paul addresses an email that he asked you about on show #52, and brings you another "Where in the Park?" game. The walk-in on this particular game is fantastic, and really demonstrates the many faceted sound environment that exists in a Disney theme park. Listen as Paul walks through the park towards our final destination, weaving you through the many layers of sound as he moves from place to place.
Paul also has a new contest for you to enter as well, featuring some great ApePenPublishing.com prizes. Be sure to get those entries in for Patricks "Small World welcome" contest as well. Send your entries to "podcast@windowtothemagic.com" before the deadlines indicated in the shows.

Also this week, we are sponsored by sky-magic.com. At sky-magic.com you can view and purchase high-resolution aerial photographs of the Disney theme parks and resorts, as well as other places, in the form of wall posters and calendars. item.title: WindowToTheMagic.com Podcast Show #054 - 1 Year Anniversary Special
item.description:
WindowtotheMagic celebrates it's first anniversary with a round-table style discussion with Paul Barrie, Patrick Hurd, Calvin Barrie, Tairy Woodard and Mouseketeer Greg. Topics range from memories of the first year to thoughts on where the podcast might go from here. Also featured is a look back at the first year of wttm produced by Patrick featuring hightlights (and low points) from the first 53 shows.
A regular show will be available this weekend as usual, this is a special episode.
This show is sponsored by The Pointnorth Media convention.
Come to the Pointnorth Media convention. Aug. 25-26th just outside roanoke Virginia. Guest speakers include Magaret Kerry, animation actress for tinkerbell, Celeste Yarnall from Classic Star Trek, Suzanne Lloyd from disney's Zorro, Spice Williams from Star Trek V, and many others. There will be media workshops and the evening of the 26th you can dine with the stars, where you pick the celebrity of your choice to dine with for the evening. Sign up now as seating is limited. For information on this exciting event go to www.pointingnorth.com
Email: podcast@windowtothemagic.com VoiceMail: 206-984-WTTM (9886) Forum: http://www.disneypodcastnet.com
83 minutes ))STEREO((

item.title: WindowToTheMagic.com Podcast Show #050
item.description:
PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES! PIRATES!
WindowtotheMagic takes you to the Disneyland Resort to climb aboard the classic Disney attraction, Pirates of the Caribbean, as it sets sail with re-imagined special effects, enhanced storytelling and some crew from the blockbuster film. These new updates are fantastic, and WindowtotheMagic takes you there in BINAURAL AUDIO!
Also included are the winners of the Windowtothemagic.com contest from show #45, and a "man on the street" style conversation with Inside the Magic host Ricky Brigante about Walt Disney World's Pirate ride which opened on July 1st as well. We discuss, compare and rate the updates "live" coast to coast.
**IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT**
Join us on the videocast Tuesday, July 4th for a FULL VIDEO RIDE-THRU of the Disneyland attraction with WindowtotheMagic Enhanced Video which shows you every detail of this fantastic attraction. YOU WILL NOT BELIEVE THE QUALITY OF THE RIDE-THRU THAT WE HAVE CAPTURED.
Email: podcast@windowtothemagic.com VoiceMail: (206) 984-9886 Forums: http://www.disneypodcastnet.com DVD Store: http://store.windowtothemagic.com
41 minutes 34 seconds ))STEREO(( and ))))BINAURAL((((

item.title: WindowToTheMagic.com Podcast Show #046
item.description:
NEVER BEFORE... Part 1 of 2
PAUL IS BACK... after a 3 week break, Paul Barrie returns as host of the show with a story about what he had done recently while at the Disneyland Resort that he had never done before... The story begins this week and will continue during next weeks podcast as well. Join Paul for a unique look at Disneyland, and you might consider trying this yourself next time you are at the park.
ApePenPublishing.com continues to sponsor the WindowtotheMagic.com Podcast, and we thank Carlene for her continued support. Please visit apepenpublishing.com and join the APP forums for your chance to win great prizes, including one of a kind signed artwork from Disney Imagineers, as well as copies of her fabulous hard bound books of Disneyland photography HOMECOMING: Destination Disneyland and Disneyland: The Beginning.
Also in this show is information regarding the Behind the Magic: 50 Years of Disneyland exhibit at the Oakland Museum of Art, which is open through August 20th, 2006, and a special message to wttm listeners from the creator of the audio tour for the exhibit which features ambient sounds provided by windowtothemagic!
And finally in this show, Mouseketeer Greg pulls a fast one, and makes Paul GREEN WITH ENVY! Listen in to find out how...
1h18m05s ))STEREO((

item.description: Patrick Hurd returns with his monthly show, and MAN! This (in Paul's opinion) is Patrick's best show to date! item.description: This is the one you've been waiting for, folks! This is the big "end of the year spectacular" where we play the "Where In The Park?" game and you guys can win an iPod Shuffle! Entries must be received by 1159pm Pacific Time, on Saturday, December 17th, 2005 and the winner will be announced on our Christmas Day podcast! This is a long one folks, so sit back, relax, and enjoy your WINDOW TO THE MAGIC! 90mins. ))STEREO((

item.description: Music, Music, Music... It's some of the best stuff at Disneyland, and that's what this show is all about - Disneyland Music! item.title: WindowToTheMagic.com Podcast Show #16
item.description: After a fantastic Halloween show, we settle back into our regular format with a "Where In The Park?" game FOR PRIZES! After you listen to this show, be sure to submit your contest entries to podcast@windowtothemagic.com for your chance to win some great Disney themed DVDs, or a WindowToTheMagic Podcast T-shirt! 53mins ))STEREO((

item.title: WindowToTheMagic.com Podcast Show #15
item.description: Ghost Host, er GUEST HOST Patrick Hurd takes us on a wild and informative trip through the world of Disney's Haunted Attractions, LP's, Movies, and more, as we celebrate the spookiest time of year. No "Run of the mill" recycled content here, folks. This is all new content, with many surprises and twists along the way. Listen carefully... things are not always as they seem. ENJOY and HAPPY HALLOWEEN ! ! !

item.title: WindowToTheMagic.com Podcast Show #13
item.description: Howdy Pardner! We're back from Disneyland, and this week we have the first of a multi part series on that underappreciated land, Frontierland! Visit the Golden Horseshoe, Keel Boats, Wally Boag, Listener emails, Billy Hill, Walt Disney, 2 new contests, Betty Taylor, The Diamond Horseshoe, Peco Goofy, listener voicemails and a special segment by guest host, Patrick Hurd! And this is just what is in PART ONE ! ! ! We have so much stuff, we are gonna continue this next week too! Join us for a hoedown of Mega-Disney proportions. 69 mins )))STEREO(((

item.title: WindowToTheMagic.com Podcast Show #12
item.description: RAW, UNEDITED... ALMOST LIVE from Disneyland! Paul and his son Calvin take you on a quick trip into the park on the evening of their arrival in Anaheim. Posted 3 hours after it was recorded, this guerilla podcast takes you from the freeways of Southern California, to one of Disneyland's Major E-Ticket attractions. 55mins ))STEREO((

item.title: WindowToTheMagic.com Podcast Show #11
item.description: A little something different this time... An interview with X Atencio and Kathy Beaumont recorded live at the NFFC convention in July 2005. This interview contains wonderful stories of their days providing "Voices in the Park" and other highlights of their careers with Disney. This recording is made possible through the generousity of the National Fantasy Fan Club (NFFC). It is provided here as a way for me to show you how much fun you can have as a member of the NFFC and to encourage you to join. Visit NFFC.org for more information. 55 mins. )))STEREO(((
